member.name: F:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillMiddlewareExtensions._fakeie11Polyfill
member.summary: Used to return an empty file but hashed with some dummy valid values in order to generate a usable Hash/ETag for browser caching

member.name: M:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillOptions.GetJavascriptToInject
member.summary: The returned value will be injected before the polyfill content

member.name: P:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillOptions.ForceES5Fallback
member.summary:
If the parameter is set to , the blazor.polyfill.js library content will always be returned and the blazor.server.js library will always be transpiled to ES5 with the needed fixes.
If this parameter is set to , only Internet Explorer 11 and Edge Legacy will have the ES5 fallback behavior.
Default value is .

member.name: P:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillOptions.ES5FallbackValidation
member.summary:
Provide a method that validate if the current request should return the ES5 Fallback behavior or not. This can be useful if you want to extend the polyfill to some other browsers and/or conditions specific values.
Note that if option is set to true, the return value will have no effect.
Also, Internet Explorer 11 and Edge Legacy will always return the ES5 Fallback behavior in all scenarios.

member.name: P:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillOptions.JavascriptModuleImportEmulation
member.summary:
If enabled, the polyfill library will assume that you have added the BlazorPolyfill.Build library to your project and will try to load the generated ES5 scripts version of your javascript modules at boot after the polyfill library initialization on client side.
You can customize the expected library path and name to load through property

member.name: P:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.BlazorPolyfillOptions.JavascriptModuleImportEmulationLibraryPath
member.summary: Get or set the value of the path location of your ES5 javascript library file that emulate your regular javascript modules, generated from the BlazorPolyfill.Build package. The path given will be used to load your modules after the polyfill initialization. Default value is: "/es5module.min.js"

member.name: M:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.HttpRequestExtensions.IsInternetExplorer(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest)
member.summary: If Internet Explorer is detected, return true

member.summary: If Internet Explorer is detected, return true

member.name: M:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.HttpRequestExtensions.BrowserNeedES5Fallback(Microsoft.AspNetCore.Http.HttpRequest)
member.summary: If the current user-agent in the request is eligible for ES5 fallback, return true

member.name: T:Blazor.Polyfill.Server.Model.FileContentReference
member.summary: This class is intentionally a kind of placeholder in order to avoid "value" copy of the file stored with the string class. We want a kind of "ref" behavior, with the value copied/written only
